resources.string: An Othello game always starts off in this position shown; with two discs of each colour intersecting each other diagonally. The top right disc is always black from either players sitting view.

First move always goes to black, in order to make a legal move the player must place their colour on one of the empty squares on the board. The disc must directly sandwich one or more opposing colours, in either horizontal, vertical or diagonal directions. This is then followed by the flipping of the sandwiched discs. If a player has no moves available to them. Their turn is forfeit until they have an available move.

The game continues on until the players either run out of spaces on the board or there are no valid moves left. The winner is decided by the number of points or pieces he or she has. If a player runs out of time, they automatically lose, regardless of accumulated points

The Basic rules of othello: Rule 1: Black/bottom always goes first. Rule 2: You can only place your piece beside your opponent\'s to sandwich it between yours. Rule 3: if you can\'t make a move you forfeit your turn. Rule 4: Game is over when either player can\'t make a move or run out of space ont the game board.

The aim of the game is to win by having the control of the game board to do this you must sandwich your opponent\'s pieces with your own. doing so you will gain points/ score. If your pieces get turned over you lose some of the points that you have earned. Aim to lose as little points if possible for a better high score.

Once you start to play the game it becomes fairly easy to understand, but there can be a lot more thinking behind it, experienced players will have strategies. Try to create some of your own so that you can beat your opponent
